title: How to Clean Silver Turquoise Jewelry

steps.title: Dampen a cloth with water.
steps.content: Dampen a cloth with water. Cleaners and turquoise generally don't mix. Turquoise is very susceptible to damage and discoloration. Even mild dishwashing detergent can damage the stone. Stick to using a damp rag. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Wipe down the stone.
steps.content: Wipe down the stone. Remove any unwanted dirt or grime. Use gentle motions to avoid damage. If your turquoise is very dirty, this may take some time. However, do not dip turquoise in water to speed up the process. This can harm the gem. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Dry your jewelry with a clean cloth.
steps.content: Dry your jewelry with a clean cloth. Gently dab any excess water from the turquoise. Letting water sit on the turquoise can harm the gem, so it's vital to get it dry after cleaning. [3] X Research source Never air dry turquoise or use heat to speed up the process.

steps.title: Use a commercial silver polish.
steps.content: Use a commercial silver polish. Silver rarely needs washing when it's attached to turquoise and, as cleaners can harm turquoise, it's generally best to stick to a light polishing. Use a commercial polish designed specifically for silver. [4] X Research source You can find a silver polish online or at some department stores. Another option is to use a silver polishing cloth, which contains chemicals that clean and polish silver. [5] X Expert Source Edward Lewand Graduate Gemologist & Accredited Appraiser Expert Interview. 6 August 2019.

steps.title: Rub down the silver with the polish.
steps.content: Rub down the silver with the polish. Read your polish's instructions for precise directions. Usually, you use a cloth or rag to gently buff the polish onto the silver. Keep buffing until the silver shines and any tarnish, dirt, or debris are removed. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Keep silver polish away from the turquoise portion of the jewelry.
steps.content: Keep silver polish away from the turquoise portion of the jewelry. Work extremely slowly when cleaning silver jewelry. Silver polish, even in small amounts, can harm turquoise. Take extreme care not to get any polish on the turquoise. [7] X Research source In the event that trace amounts of polish end up on your turquoise, remove them right away. You can dab them out with a paper towel or rag.

steps.title: Protect the jewelry from harsh cleansers.
steps.content: Protect the jewelry from harsh cleansers. As turquoise is so sensitive, you do not want to risk exposing it to cleaners. Things like dish soap, laundry detergent, and other cleaners can easily damage turquoise. Remove turquoise jewelry when cleaning and keep it in a safe place where it will not be exposed to any cleaners. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Avoid using hand lotion when wearing turquoise.
steps.content: Avoid using hand lotion when wearing turquoise. If you're wearing things like rings and bracelets made of turquoise, it's best to avoid or minimize your use of hand lotion. Hand lotion, like most household products, can potentially damage turquoise. [9] X Research source Sunscreen may also be harmful. If you've applied sunscreen to your chest, do not wear a turquoise necklace afterwards.

steps.title: Keep your jewelry dry.
steps.content: Keep your jewelry dry. In addition to drying turquoise after cleaning it, strive to keep it dry in general. Do not leave it sitting out in damp places, such as beside the kitchen sink [10] X Research source

steps.title: Clean your turquoise when it gets dirty.
steps.content: Clean your turquoise when it gets dirty. As turquoise jewelry is very sensitive, cleaning it too often may damage the stone. To keep it in good shape, only clean the turquoise when it appears dirty.
